title: Album Page, "Sketches of Details and Plan of Architectural Elements, Tower at Milan, Italy", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on smooth, thick off-white wove paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 133; lower right corner (perpendicular to drawing): 127.  Other inscriptions too numerous and detailed to note here. Please consult image of recto.  Verso, in graphite, bottom of drawing: Tower at Milan. Again, many other inscriptions are contained here. Please refer to an image of the verso of the drawing.
dimensions: Sheet: 25.1 x 16.3 cm (9 7/8 x 6 7/16 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet tipped horizontally into binding consisting mainly of inscriptions and a few small sketches.  At center left is a plan view of an arcade supported by three columns.  To the right of this is a small column supporting an architrave and rendered separately below it is the base of the same column, its dimensions included as well.  At bottom left is another molding profile.  The verso contains a similarly high ratio of inscriptions to sketches.  At the very top of the sheet is a small, square plan, and to the right of it a view in plan of a span supported by a composition of double colonettes and a single colonette. The rest of the sheet below this contains inscriptions.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketches of Details and Plan of Architectural Elements, Tower at Milan, Italy", late 19th century.Graphite on smooth, thick off-white wove paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-322.
